content.description:
This is one of the better climbs in the Undiscovered Country. Although rated V10 in the Miramontes guidebook, it seems easier.

Hop to a pair of jugs about 8 feet off the ground on the overhanging face of the Soul Caliber Boulder. Make big moves through a black plate to a mellow topout.
content.protection: One or two pads will do it. If you fall off the move to the lip, you just land on the big boulder underneath the Soul Caliber Boulder. However, if you fall off one of the first two moves, you could bounce off this boulder before hitting the ground.
content.location: Overhanging face on the Soul Caliber Boulder

content.description:
If Soul Caliber left you wanting more, do this sit-start. The River Styx adds some bigger, harder moves and spans the entire face of the boulder.

Sit start (butt in the dirt) on a mega-jug flake at the bottom left of the overhanging face. Make a massive move to a tiny, sharp crimp on a black pluton. Hang tight through a quarter-pad crimp and a decent sloper before finishing up on Soul Caliber.

The grade is very tentative.
content.protection: Pads. You risk bouncing off the lower boulder once you get onto Soul Caliber. The lower part of the climb is safe, although you do slump against a small boulder when you miss the opening move.
content.location: Sit-start at the bottom left of the overhanging face.
